body_html:
While I think it unlikely that many folks will have GPUs from two different vendors in the same machine (although it is possible), I think it is likely that folks may wish to build a single binary that they deploy on two different kinds of machine. Hence my preference for a run-time vs compile-time test.

It is true that TF programmers would have to avoid hard-coding a particular GPU device in their code, but that's increasingly true anyway — there are a large and growing set of ML accelerator hardware vendors, so my temptation is to say "fix models to allow specifying a target device via, say, a flag".

@zheng-xq do you have an opinion here?
